Package com.i2group.apollo.events.transport

Contains classes for the events that commands can fire, as well as classes and interfaces that define changes to the Analysis Repository.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IChangeSet<TChange extends IIdentifiable,TNew extends IIdentifiable> A set of changes made to an object in the Analysis Repository by executing a command.
IDataSourceSchemaEvent An event that was generated during the creation of a DataSource, or by a change to its Schema.
IItemChangeSet A set of changes made to an Item by executing a command.
ISecurityPermissionChangeSet A set of security permissions to be applied to an Item by executing a command.
 

Class Summary
CardAddedToItemEvent The event that is created when a Card is added to an Item.
CardAmendedEvent The event that is created when a Card is amended on an Item.
CardChangeSet Contains data for a new Card, or a set of changes to an existing Card.
CardDeletedFromItemEvent The event that is created when a Card is deleted from an Item.
DataSourceCreatedEvent The event that is created when a DataSource is created.
DataSourceSchemaAmendedEvent The event that is created when a DataSource or its Schema is amended.
EntityCreatedEvent The event that is created when an Entity is created.
EntityMergedEvent The event that is created when one Entity receives the Cards from another Entity as a result of a merge operation.
EntitySupplantedEvent The event that is created when one Entity is supplanted by another Entity as a result of a merge operation.
Event An abstract implementation of IEvent that other IEvent implementations should extend.
ItemDeletedEvent The event that is created when an Item is deleted.
ItemPurgedEvent The event that is created when an Item is purged.
LinkAmendedEvent The event that is created when a Link is amended.
LinkCreatedEvent The event that is created when a Link is created.
MergedCardChangeSet Contains data for a Card created during a merge operation, plus source information from the original Card in its host Item.
PrimaryPropertiesChangedEvent The event that is created when the PrimaryPropertyIdentifiers are set on an Item.
PropertyChange Describes a change to an existing Property.
PropertyChangeSet Contains a set of Property changes for a single Card on an Item.
PropertyGroupChange Describes a change to an existing PropertyGroup.
PropertyGroupChangeSet Contains a set of PropertyGroup changes for a single Card on an Item.
SecurityDefinition The security information that an Item or an alert feed needs in order to calculate SecurityAccessLevels and SecurityGrantLevels.
SecurityPermissionChangeEvent The event that is created when the SecurityAccessPermissions are set on an Item.
SecuritySchemaAmendedEvent The event that is created when the SecuritySchema is amended.
SecuritySchemaCreatedEvent The event that is created when the SecuritySchema is created.
SetAmendedEvent The event that is created when a set is amended.
SetAmendment Describes a single change to a set: an item added, or an item removed.
 

Enum Summary
EventType Indicates the type of an Event.
SetAmendmentType Indicates the type of a SetAmendment.
VersionChangeType Indicates the type of a change that produced a new version of an Item.
 

Package com.i2group.apollo.events.transport Description

Contains classes for the events that commands can fire, as well as classes and interfaces that define changes to the Analysis Repository.

When a command causes a source entity to be merged into a target entity, the following events are fired:

  • EntityMergedEvent, affecting the target entity.
  • EntitySupplantedEvent, affecting the source entity.
EntityMergedEvent contains a copy of the data from the source entity, with new identifiers for each of the cards, properties, and property groups. (This ensures that there are no conflicts with existing identifiers in the target.) The data is added to the target entity.

EntitySupplantedEvent contains the ItemIdentifierAndVersion of the target of the merge operation. The data is added to the source entity. When an entity has been supplanted, no further operations (with the exception of purge) can affect it.

When the source in a merge operation has links to other entities, LinkCreatedEvents are fired. The purpose of these events is to create links between the target and the other entities to which the source is linked. The new links contain copies of the data from the existing links.

The LinkCreatedEvents have an additional field that indicates the ItemIdentifierAndVersion of the existing link from which the new link was generated. When this field is set on a link, it indicates that the link was created in a merge operation.

If the source in a merge operation has a link connecting it to the target, then no LinkCreatedEvent is fired for that link. This would create a link that connects the target to itself, which is not allowed in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

When source entities that were members of sets are merged, the target is added to all of the sets that the source was a member of. This is carried out during processing of either EntityMergedEvent or EntitySupplantedEvent.

Consider this example:

  • Entity A is connected to two other entities, X and Y:
    • A--L1--X
    • A--L2--Y
  • Entity B is connected to another entity, Z:
    • B--L3--Z
  • A command merges A into C, and B into C:
    • A-->C
    • B-->C
The command produces the following events, in the following order:
  • A LinkCreatedEvent connecting C to X:
    • C--L1Copy--X
  • A LinkCreatedEvent connecting C to Y:
    • C--L2Copy--Y
  • An EntityMergedEvent for the merging of A into C:
    • A-->C
  • An EntitySupplantedEvent for the supplanting of A
  • A LinkCreatedEvent connecting C to Z:
    • C--L3Copy--Z
  • An EntityMergedEvent for the merging of B into C:
    • B-->C
  • An EntitySupplantedEvent for the supplanting of B

Since:
1.0
